alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Lunenburg; Nottoway; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 7:46PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Prince Edward, northwestern Lunenburg, northwestern Nottoway and western Amelia Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 746 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Green Bay, or 8 miles northeast of Keysville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Green Bay around 750 PM EDT. Burkeville around 800 PM EDT. Crewe and Rice around 805 PM EDT. Jetersville around 815 PM EDT. Amelia Courthouse and Morven around 830 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Prince Edward Station, Arvins Store, Twin Lakes State Park, Rodophil, Nutbush, Burkes Tavern, Scholfield, Moran, Winterham and Paineville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
